Package org.actioncontroller

Action Controller is a framework that takes "controller" classes and generates ApiControllerAction for each method annotated with a "routing mapper annotation" such as Get. Example 
 public class TestController {

     @Get("/uppercase")
     @ContentBody
     public String upcase(@RequestParam("myParam") String parameter) {
         return parameter.toUpperCase();
     }
 }

In this example, Get is a routing mapper annotation because it is annotated HttpRouterMapping. This annotation refers to Get.ActionFactory and Get.ActionFactory.create(org.actioncontroller.Get, java.lang.Object, java.lang.reflect.Method, org.actioncontroller.ApiControllerContext) is used to create an ApiControllerMethodAction.

ApiControllerMethodAction uses the RequestParam annotation on the parameter to decide how this parameter is mapped from the request. RequestParam is annotated with HttpParameterMapping, which refers to RequestParam.MapperFactory. RequestParam.MapperFactory again is used to create a HttpParameterMapper which extracts the method argument from the http request.

ApiControllerMethodAction further uses the ContentBody annotation on the method to determine how the return value is mapped the the response. ContentBody is annotated with HttpReturnMapping, which refers to ContentBody.MapperFactory. ContentBody.MapperFactory is used to create a HttpReturnMapper which converts the method return value to the http response.

A controller can be used in three contexts:

  • With ApiServlet to extract actions to be used in a servlet container
  • With ApiHandler to extract actions to be used with HttpServer
  • With ApiClientProxy to extract actions to call a REST service via HTTP
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ApiControllerAction
    The core of the framework.
    UserContext  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ApiControllerContext
    Extra initialization variables for the ActionControllers.
    ApiControllerMethodAction
    Represents a single action that can be performed on a controller.
    ClientCertificate.MapperFactory  
    ContentBody.MapperFactory  
    ContentLocationHeader.MappingFactory  
    ContextUrl.MapperFactory  
    Delete.RouterMapperFactory

  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ApiActionParameterUnknownMappingException
    Thrown when action-controller couldn't find out how to map a method parameter for an action method.
    ApiActionResponseUnknownMappingException
    Thrown when action-controller couldn't find out how to map the return value for an action method.
    ApiControllerCompositeException
    Collects all exceptions during configuration of a specific controller
    HttpActionException
    Indicates that an error happened during the invocation of an action and that the user agent should receive the HTTP HttpActionException.statusCode.
    HttpRequestException
    Indicate that an action could not be executed due to missing or incorrect HTTP request values.
    HttpServerErrorException
    Indicates an unexpected event on the server during the invocation of the action.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    ClientCertificate
    Extract the HTTPS Client Certificate from the request
    ContentBody
    Set the return value in the content body with an optional content-type
    ContentLocationHeader
    Set the method return value into the Content-location response header as String or URL.
    ContextUrl
    Extract the context URL into the parameter as URL or String
    Delete
    Specifies that this method should handle HTTP DELETE requests
    Get
    Specifies that this method should handle HTTP GET requests.
    HttpHeader
    When used on a parameter, maps the HTTP Request header to the parameter, converting the type if necessary.
    HttpResponseHeader
    Maps the return value to the specified HTTP Response header
    PathParam
    Maps part of the HTTP request target to the parameter, converting the type if necessary.
    Post
    Specifies that this method should handle HTTP POST requests
    Put
    Specifies that this method should handle HTTP PUT requests
    QueryString
    Maps the raw query part of the HTTP request target to the parameter.
    RequestParam
    Maps the HTTP request parameter to the parameter, converting the type if necessary.
    RequestParam.ClientIp
    Maps the HTTP client IP to the parameter as String.
    RequireUserRole  
    SendRedirect
    Maps the method response value as an HTTP 302 redirect, supporting Strings and URLs.
    ServletUrl  
    SessionParameter
    Maps the parameter to the specified servlet session.
    UnencryptedCookie
    Maps the parameter to the specified HTTP request cookie, URL decoding and converting the type if necessary.
